step1.title: You have people who care
step1.text: This is a social organizer. It doesn't transfer money or collect payments. It helps people quickly coordinate when someone needs support.

step2.title: One signal — and the right people know
step2.text: If someone needs help — the notification reaches those who can respond. Once. No spam, no pressure.

step3.title: Everything is transparent
step3.text: Every action is recorded. Trust is built on transparency, not control.

step4.title: Add your first person
step4.text: The organizer works through connections between people. Start with one person — someone you trust.

step5.title: How to reach you
step5.text: Add at least 2 contact methods so that participants can coordinate with you when providing help.

step6.title: Monthly Support Budget
step6.text: This amount is your intention, not a commitment. No card is linked, no money is charged. You simply indicate how much you're willing to help per month. This figure is visible to your network and shows overall capabilities. When someone asks for help — you decide whether to participate or not.

landing.painQuote: When trouble strikes — you're alone. Friends don't know. Friends of friends — even less so. Yet someone among them could help.
landing.painSolution: Social Organizer solves this — one signal, and the right people find out.
landing.painQuote2: You're ready to reach out. But it's hard to trust when you don't know who's on the other side of the screen.
landing.painSolution2: Here, trust is built on connections between real people. You see the chain of handshakes to everyone.
landing.heroSubtitle: When you need help — the right people find out. No spam, no pressure, through those you trust.
landing.whatDescription: A smart address book. It helps you quickly find help through a chain of acquaintances — friends, friends of friends, up to six handshakes.
landing.cardHandshakeDesc: Mutual confirmation of an existing meaningful connection between two people. Up to 150 connections (Dunbar's number).
landing.cardIntentionDesc: A voluntary decision to help. No pressure — everyone decides for themselves whether to participate.
landing.cardTransparencyDesc: All activity is open. Reputation is built on real actions, visible to all.
landing.step1Desc: Add people you know personally. Every handshake is mutual and voluntary.
landing.step2Desc: Create a collection when you need help. The network is notified through chains of confirmed handshakes.
landing.step3Desc: Participants express intention to help voluntarily. No pressure, full transparency.
landing.howFootnote: Degree of connection shows distance in a chain of handshakes — who is whose "friend of a friend of a friend"
landing.principleEqualityDesc: All participants are equal. No structural advantages of one over another.
landing.principleSelfOrgDesc: Mutual aid emerges as a consequence of structure, not as a prescribed function.
landing.principleOpenDesc: Code is open and available on GitHub. Anyone can verify how it works.
landing.ctaTitle: Ready to activate your mutual aid network?
landing.demoBanner: Demo mode is no longer available. To use the app, open it via Telegram below. If you had an invite link — please ask the sender to share it again.
landing.footer: Social Organizer — an open mutual aid tool
